candidates.name: Alice Kibble
candidates.why_elect: I provide a different set of experiences to others and represent a group of people who are currently not represented.
candidates.why_stand: The biggest passion I have is for my community. Our rangitahi are the future of Tairawhiti, it is important their voices are heard at the council table to ensure the future we are creating is fit for them and future generations.

candidates.name: Mary Liza Manuel
candidates.why_elect: I have had previous lobbying experience with Rail Action Group and Tairawhiti Residents Assn. From there I developed resilience and collaboration being a team player. I contributed my time skills and commitment to the Gigatown comp to see a transformation in our city. I have qualifications incl governance/leadership.
candidates.why_stand: I am ready to be a part of a strong team striving for an economy and environment that will provide long term sustainability with economic development. I will champion greater transparency and ensure all residents and ratepayers have more say over decisions that affect us.

candidates.name: Glenis Philip-Barbara
candidates.why_elect: I've had a decent career so far in education and the public sector and have a huge range of skills to contribute. However, my ability to work respectfully with people from all walks for life and make room for them to realise their aspirations is most important.
candidates.why_stand: I love this place, and I want to contribute as much energy as I can to making Tairāwhiti a place where everyone thrives. For me that will be the ultimate legacy to leave for all our mokopuna (grandchildren).

candidates.name: Tony Robinson
candidates.why_elect: I am Kaiti born and raised. I have 22 years experience as a lawyer; finding solutions and advocating for people. I also have a degree in Japanese, psychology and Māori. I am not afraid to tackle difficult issues. I am intelligent, an excellent communicator and believe in open, accountable governance.
candidates.why_stand: Tairawhiti is an incredible place to live however council's projected spending, rates rises and increased debt threaten our community. We need an open and accountable council that is fiscally prudent, environmentally responsible, culturally strong and supports business development. Our council must be visionary, bold and lead our region with integrity.

candidates.name: Clive Bibby
candidates.why_elect: I understand the cultural differences and aspirations of the people who make up the populace and the economic structure necessary for this region to be self sustainable.
candidates.why_stand: I believe l have the ability and experience to make a meaningful contribution to the well being of all residents of this community.

candidates.name: Ross Chatterton
candidates.why_elect: I'm Gisborne born and raised. I know many of the issues faced by the "Common Gisbornite" first hand. I'm one of the "Have nots" who work very hard just to maintain what little we do have, and believe the decision making process shouldn't be left to the "Haves".
candidates.why_stand: I believe that to have fair representation all groups must be represented on Council. As such, we need more "Noddy Nobodies" like myself to be elected to Council.

candidates.name: Andy Cranston
candidates.why_elect: I am an experienced hardworking councillor with a history of being involved and getting things done. I am available and operate with two ears and one mouth as it is vitally important to hear all sides of our issues and fully understand them before making important decisions.
candidates.why_stand: I am fully focused to ensure Gisborne is a better place for our children and their children. I work hard to understand our opportunities and challenges and will support initiatives which will move or region forward. I will work to see our development is achieved in practical affordable ways.

candidates.name: Lizz Crawford
candidates.why_elect: I've lived and worked in our community with a diverse range of people. My experience is in the not-for-profit sector, NGOs, community development, public health, financial and governance. I've held management and governance positions. I believe in using our gifts, skills and experience to help one another.
candidates.why_stand: Tika, pono, aroha and it's constitutional. I am passionate about creating thriving communities and healthy living spaces where people are living the best life they choose in Tairawhiti. People, planet and prosperity—in that order. We've got the best place in the world, it's called home!

candidates.name: Shane Vermeulen
candidates.why_elect: Born and raised in Gizy, I think I have a good connection with people from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures. Couple that with my experiences in the building, civil, forestry and emergency industries and hopefully I can bring practicality to the table, and represents the whole region.
candidates.why_stand: I'm running for council as I want to help increase the regions work and growth opportunities, establish a region that supports and promotes a better work life balance. In turn helping our locals enjoy everyday living in the Tairawhiti.

candidates.name: Courtenay Waikari
candidates.why_elect: I am born and raised in Gisborne, a mother of two hoping to make a difference for the next generation. I am of Ngati Porou/Rongowhakaata decent and my mother's family originally hails from Scotland. I have a degree in Business Studies, majoring in Enterprise Development.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Gisborne is a unique part of the world—it is laid back yet vibrant. Community is a big part of the experience of our region—it is a city unlike any other and definitely something worth fostering.

candidates.name: Amber Dunn
candidates.why_elect: By profession, I am a scientist and hold a PhD degree. Most of my postgraduate research has focussed on Gisborne and shows my commitment and deep understanding of our place. I can ensure there is evidence, and that the evidence takes us to a logical conclusion and good decisions.
candidates.why_stand: To bring a different value set and new thinking and intelligent solutions to the governance table to resolve long-standing issues and problems of our region (eg wastewater, active transport connectivity, water supply). To protect our natural beauty and assets (beaches, rivers, parks, soil, etc) and bring our culture alive.

candidates.name: Larry Foster
candidates.why_elect: I have been a Councillor for the past six years. I have one of the highest attendance rates every year and I am committed to my role. I have owned and operated with wife Leigh numerous businesses, mainly in retailing, manufacturing and accommodation. I am positive, sensible and committed.
candidates.why_stand: It is a real privilege to represent your city and region. I love this place and want to see it prosper. Enabling the growth of our economy and protecting our pristine environment while encouraging more social interaction is a priority for me.

candidates.name: Josh Wharehinga
candidates.why_elect: I've always loved Gizzy. I only ever left to go to uni. Since returning I've only ever worked to make Gizzy a better place to live. Which I am proud to say I have done, with my work in the community, council but mostly as a father.
candidates.why_stand: I'm Gizzy through and through. I have already served two terms as a district councillor, the last couple months as Deputy Mayor and I'd like to serve a third term to ensure delivery on some key projects. I'm built to serve and want to continue doing so.

candidates.name: Debbie Gregory
candidates.why_elect: I was born and bred in Gisborne and I have been a journalist here for 17 years. For the past seven and a half years, chief reporter. I have a deep knowledge of its history and a naturally inquisitive nature alongside a drive to get to the facts.
candidates.why_stand: I have a passion for Tairawhiti and want to be part of the decision making process that will help enhance this place and make it somewhere my children and grandchildren want to live.
